Key: Hm?
...Ohh!

(I saw a familiar head of hair across the street.
As the thought came to me, the girl ran towards
me.)
Ohhh, Nii-sama!
Urk! Mana?!

I'm freaking stoked that I could meet you in
a place like this! This must be fate.

Man, you really are my Nii-sama! It's like
that sibling bond connects us together.
Okay, I get it. Please calm down!

(I hold back Mana, who's grabbed my hand
as she jumps up and down. I can hardly
believe she's an NPC.)
Were you out shopping?
Yep, just over there!

Hey, wait. What's with the mountain of ¥100-shop
goods?)

(Inside of Mana's plastic bag was a plethora
of colorful plastic goods.)

(It looks like she spent a fortune at the
¥100-shop.)

Japan's freaking incredible! You can get so
many convenient things here.
See, Nii-sama! Check this out!

(Mana pulled out a sponge with a handle. The
body was bent, allowing its user to move the
sponge at many different angles.)

It's like you're so freaking shocked that you
can't speak. An ergonomic sponge that can
reach anywhere. Talk about a freaking deal.

No. Wait, Mana... That's actually not too
practical. It's better to use a regular sponge.

No, no. With this angle, I can easily wash my
back.

It's not really adjustable, so you're making it
harder for yourself.
Oh...

Hmph. You've got no freaking imagination,
Nii-sama.
(Mana punched me lightly.)

(She's reliable when battling a Spirit, but
seeing her act like this, I remember she's
just a kid.)

(In fact, if she's buying all this crap, I'm
starting to worry about her everyday life.)

If you keep buying weird stuff like this, you'll
have no room at home. Don't buy things you
don't need, got it?
Okaaaay...

(Mana, appearing displeased, puffed out
her cheeks. However, she became cheerful
again in no time.)

But I've never been scolded like this by
you, Nii-sama! Even though you're upset,
it still makes me freaking happy!
Hey, now. Keep it together, okay?
Right!

(Seeing Mana smile happily makes me smile too.
Well, I guess I'll see her again... whenever
she cleans her room.)
